column4: anyone here know how to set up PuTTY so that i can use PuTTY to ssh to my home machine, then from the home machine, ssh to another home machine ( ssh -Y machine ?), then use tightvnc to vnc to the remote machine by telling tighvnc to connect to 127.0.0.1:5900 on the local machine?
anyone?  bueler?  fry?
Check out the "-L" switch I think it is.
You might want to look into "port forwarding"
i have PuTTY set to forward 5900 dynamically
putty should do it in one go...
its just you <-> home machine <-> vnc server right?
local machine <-> remote machine 1 <-> remote machine 2
and the vnc server is running on remote machine 2?
or is it on another machine, only viewable by rem mac 2?
well BOTH remote machines have vnc server running...  but i was thinking that the tunnel would be through the middle machine all the way to the remote -- no?
what vnc server do you want to connect to? the one running on remote machine 2?
the farthest remote machine has a working vnc server running
ok
right
this is easy then, in putty ssh to remote machine 1, in the ssh > tunnel menu, add remote machine 2's ip, and put 5900 in both local and destination ports.
Then connect, and finally vnc to localhost:5900

in theory, i should be able to forward a any attempt to connect to this local machine's :5900 to the middle machine (if tunnel stop there), or if tunnel goes to last machine (and port forwarding i set up properly) i should be able to vnc to that remote machine 2 right?
ok - so i am getting closer
i.e. http://static.unto.net/putty_tunnel_added.jpg - there have "5900" in the "source port" and <remote machine 2's ip>:5900 in the "destination"
no if you set that up as i've explained, you will vnc to localhost:5900 and it'll send you directly to <remote machine 2's ip>:5900
by magic :-)
http://souptonuts.sourceforge.net/sshtips.htm has an explanation halfway down (search for "putty for windowsxp")
thanks for Your help
